page.title: 08MEMORIES and CHANGE (2)
page.content:
Gas and electricity services were first supplied to Thorner in the 1920's. There was even a water pump in Samsites ginnel.
Farms and field sizes were smaller before the Second World War.
Sanitation today is by flush toilets, but residents remember ash pits and the soil being taken to a special tip in Thorner.
There are few old residents still in Thorner...the village now has many people who use the village only as a dormitory...they work in Leeds or Wetherby or other larger towns.
